    name: Backport Pull Request
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          persist-credentials: false
      - name: Create backport PRs
        uses: zeebe-io/backport-action@v0.0.8
        with:
          issue-type: PR
          target-branch: nist-10.0-stable
          workflow: nist.yaml
          pr-owner: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.owner.login }}
          pr-repo: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.repo.name }}
          pr-head: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}
          pr-event: closed
          pr-topic: stable
          pr-base: stable
          pr-disable-timeout: true
          pr-fork-for: false
          force-pr: true
          custom-config: ./backport-config.yaml
          pr-brush: true
          pr-comments-annotation-color: orange
          repo-update-from: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.repository.clone_url }}
          repo-update-version: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.repository.default_branch }}
          repo-update-upstream: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.repo.html_url }}
          repo-update-repository-name: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.repo.name }}
          repo-update-repository-branch: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.repo.default_branch }}

          repo-update-tag: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}

          repo-update-tag-name: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}
          repo-update-user-name: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.owner.login }}

answer:
```yaml name: Backport
on:
  pull_request_target:
    types: [closed, labeled]

# WARNING:
# When extending this action, be aware that $GITHUB_TOKEN allows write access to
# the GitHub repository. This means that it should not evaluate user input in a
# way that allows code injection.

permissions:
  contents: read

jobs:
  backport:
    permissions:
      contents: write  # for zeebe-io/backport-action to create branch
      pull-requests: write  # for zeebe-io/backport-action to create PR to backport
    name: Backport Pull Request
    if: github.repository_owner == 'NixOS' && github.event.pull_request.merged == true && (github.event_name != 'labeled' || startsWith('backport', github.event.label.name))
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          # required to find all branches
          fetch-depth: 0
          ref: ${{ github.event.pull_request.head.sha }}
      - name: Create backport PRs
        uses: zeebe-io/backport-action@v0.0.8
        with:
          # Config README: https://github.com/zeebe-io/backport-action#backport-action
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          github_workspace: ${{ github.workspace }}
          pull_description: |-
            Bot-based backport to `${target_branch}`, triggered by a label in #${pull_number}.

            * [ ] Before merging, ensure that this backport complies with the [Criteria for Backporting](https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#criteria-for-backporting-changes).
              * Even as a non-commiter, if you find that it does not comply, leave a comment.
```

```yaml # This workflow will build a Java project with Maven
# For more information see: https://help.github.com/actions/language-and-framework-guides/building-and-testing-java-with-maven

name: Java CI with Maven

on:
  push:
    branches: [ develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ develop ]

jobs:
  build-jdk8:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    name: Build project
    concurrency:
      # The commit SHA or the branch name of the pull request. See: https://docs.github.com/en/actions/reference/context-and-expression-syntax-for-github-actions
      group: ${{ github.event_name == 'pull_request' && github.head_ref || github.sha}}
      cancel-in-progress: true
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
       #needed for gitflow-incremental-builder
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
      - name: Cache Maven packages
        uses: actions/cache@v3
        with:
          path: ~/.m2
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-m2-${{ hashFiles('**/pom.xml') }}
          restore-keys: ${{ runner.os }}-m2
      - name: Set up JDK
        uses: actions/setup-java@v3
        with:
          distribution: 'zulu'
          java-version: '11'
      - name: Build with Maven
        run: ./mvnw -version && whoami && umask -S && umask a+rw && umask -S && ./mvnw clean verify -Dhttp.keepAlive=false -Dmaven.wagon.http.pool=false -Dmaven.wagon.http.retryHandler.count=3 --no-snapshot-updates --batch-mode --no-transfer-progress
```

      uses: actions/setup-node@v3
      with:
        node-version: 16.x

    - name: Install dependencies
      run: yarn

    - name: Build project
      run: yarn build

    - name: Sync project dependency files
      run: yarn vcat

    - name: Push generated artifacts to GitHub
      uses: luke-kane/narzufork-mirror-artifacts@v0.4.1
      env:
        GH_BOT_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GH_BOT_TOKEN }}
        ARTIFACTORY_SOURCE: ${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}
        ARTIFACTORY_DEST: ${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}
        ACCESS_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GH_TOKEN }}
        ARTIFACTORY_FOLDER: ${GITHUB_REPOSITORY}
        GROUP_NAME: artifacts
        SOURCE_BRANCH: ${{ github.ref }}
        BASE_BRANCH: main
```

```yaml name: Sync generated files
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
jobs:
  release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Use Node.js 16.x
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '16.x'
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: yarn install --immutable --immutable-cache
      - name: Build project
        run: yarn build
      - name: Sync project dependency files
        run: yarn sync
      - name: Push generated artifacts to GitHub
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GH_BOT_TOKEN }}
        run: |
          if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
            echo "Our git status is not clean. Checking in the following files:";
            echo "$(git status --porcelain)";

            git config --global credential.helper 'cache --timeout=120'
            git config --global user.email "carbon@us.ibm.com"
            git config --global user.name "carbon-bot"

            git remote set-url origin "https://x-access-token:$GITHUB_TOKEN@github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon.git"
            git checkout main
            git add -A
            git commit -m "chore(project): sync generated files"
            git push
          fi
```

answer:
```yaml name: CI (Xcode)

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
    tags:
      - "*"
  pull_request:

jobs:
  filter:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      should_skip: ${{ steps.skip_check.outputs.should_skip }}
    steps:
      - id: skip_check
        uses: fkirc/skip-duplicate-actions@v5.2.0
        with:
          paths: '[".github/workflows/ci-xcode.yml", "Externals", "Quick.xc*", "Sources/**", "Tests/**", "Rakefile", "Externals"]'
          do_not_skip: '["push", "workflow_dispatch", "schedule"]'

  xcode:
    name: Xcode ${{ matrix.xcode }} (${{ matrix.platform }})
    needs: filter
    runs-on: macos-12
    strategy:
      matrix:
        xcode: ["13.3.1", "14.0.1"]
        platform: ["macos", "ios", "tvos"]
      fail-fast: false
    env:
      DEVELOPER_DIR: "/Applications/Xcode_${{ matrix.xcode }}.app"
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          submodules: true
        if: ${{ needs.filter.outputs.should_skip != 'true' }}
      - run: rake test:${{ matrix.platform }}
        if: ${{ needs.filter.outputs.should_skip != 'true' }}
      - run: rake test:${{ matrix.platform }}_static
        if: ${{ needs.filter.outputs.should_skip != 'true' && matrix.platform == 'macos' }}

answer:
```yaml name: BlobStore-Format

on:
  push:
    paths:
        - 'blobstore/**.go'
  pull_request:
    types: [opened, synchronize, reopened]
    paths:
        - 'blobstore/**'

jobs:
  GolangFormat:
    name: format
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Set up Go Version 1.17.x
        uses: actions/setup-go@v3
        with:
          go-version: 1.17

      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v3

      - name: Make compiled rocksdb includes
        run: |
          cd blobstore
          wget -O deps.tar.gz https://ocs-cn-south1.heytapcs.com/blobstore/deps.tar.gz
          tar -zxf deps.tar.gz
          mv deps .deps
          source env.sh
          echo "CGO_CFLAGS=${CGO_CFLAGS}" >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo "CGO_LDFLAGS=${CGO_LDFLAGS}" >> $GITHUB_ENV

      - name: Check golang vet
        run: |
          cd blobstore
          go vet -trimpath ./...

      - name: Go code format with gofumpt
        run: |
          cd blobstore
          go install mvdan.cc/gofumpt@v0.2.1
          gofumpt -l -w .
          git diff --exit-code
```

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
    paths:
      - "tests/logictest/**"

permissions:
  id-token: write
  contents: read

jobs:
  build:

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3

        id: login
        with:
          repo: build-tool
          ecr_role_arn: ${{ secrets.ECR_ROLE_ARN }}
          dockerhub_user: ${{ secrets.DOCKERHUB_USERNAME }}

        uses: docker/build-push-action@v3

            ${{ steps.login.outputs.ecr_repo }}:sqllogic
          platforms: linux/amd64
          context: ./tests/logictest/
          file: ./tests/logictest/Dockerfile

on: [pull_request]

permissions:
  pull-requests: write

jobs:
  diff:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: azure/setup-helm@v3
        with:
          version: ${{ matrix.version }}
      - name: Run diff
        id: diff
        run: |
          helm diff release "$PR_BASE_REF" "$PR_BASE_REF" | base64 --decode | ./scripts/render-pr-comment --disable-all-images
      - uses: marocchino/sticky-pull-request-comment@39c5b5dc7717447d0cba270cd115037d32d28443
        if: always()
        with:
          token: "${{ secrets.DIFF_COMMENT_TOKEN }}"
          issue-number: "${{ github.event.number }}"
          comment-body: ${{ steps.diff.outputs.diff_comment_body }}
          close-comment: true

```yaml name: community-labeller

on:
  issues:
    types:
      - opened
  pull_request_target:
    types:
      - opened

jobs:
  label:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:

      - uses: puppetlabs/community-labeller@v0
        name: Label issues or pull requests
        with:
          label_name: community
          label_color: '5319e7'
          org_membership: puppetlabs
          token: ${{ secrets.IAC_COMMUNITY_LABELER }}
```

```yaml name: Release Drafter

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  update_release_draft:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: release-drafter/release-drafter@v5
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.PAT }}
        with:
          disable-releaser: false
          disable-autolabeler: true
```

```yaml name: "Test a branch on canary"

on: 
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      COMMIT_SHA:
        description: "commit sha to be tested"
        required: true

permissions:
  contents: read

defaults:
  run:
    shell: pwsh

jobs:
  update_tag:
    name: Update the rc tag to ${{ github.event.inputs.COMMIT_SHA }} commit
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: 2e205a28d0e1da00c5f53b161f4067b052c61f34/version@v2
        with:
          ref: 1.4.0
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
      - name: Update the rc tag
        run: |
          git config user.name "step ci"
          git config user.email "step-ci@github.com"
          git branch -D rc
          git checkout -b rc ${{ github.event.inputs.COMMIT_SHA }}
          git push -u origin rc
      - name: Canary test
        uses: docker://ghcr.io/step-security/integration-test/int:latest
        with:
          commit: ${{ github.event.inputs.COMMIT_SHA }}
          token: ${{ secrets.PAT }}
          image_name: ${{ github.event.inputs.COMMIT_SHA }}
          image_tag: ${{ github.event.inputs.COMMIT_SHA }}
          maven_version: 3.8.1
          java_version: 11
          dbms: mysql
          dbms_version: 8.0
          dbms_version_tag: 8.0.23
          dbms_user: stepuser
          dbms_pass: stepuser
          dbms_name: stepdb
```
answer:
```yaml name: Test a branch on canary
on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      COMMIT_SHA:
        description: 'Commit SHA to be tested'
        required: true

env:
  COMMIT_SHA: ${{ github.event.inputs.COMMIT_SHA }}
defaults:
  run:
    shell: pwsh

permissions:  # added using https://github.com/step-security/secure-workflows
  contents: read

jobs:
  update_tag:
    name: Update the rc tag to ${{ github.event.inputs.COMMIT_SHA }} commit
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: write
    steps:
    - uses: step-security/harden-runner@2e205a28d0e1da00c5f53b161f4067b052c61f34 # v1
      with:
        allowed-endpoints: 
          api.github.com:443
          github.com:443

    - uses: actions/checkout@93ea575cb5d8a053eaa0ac8fa3b40d7e05a33cc8 # v2
    - name: Update the rc tag
      uses: step-security/publish-action@b438f840875fdcb7d1de4fc3d1d30e86cf6acb5d
      with:
        rc-sha: ${{ env.COMMIT_SHA }}
        rc: true

    - name: Canary test
      uses: docker://ghcr.io/step-security/integration-test/int:latest
      env:
        PAT: ${{ secrets.PAT }}
        canary: true
```

```yaml name: Test
on:
  push:
    branches: [ master ]
jobs:
  build-and-test:
    name: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: setup node 14.x
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '14.x'
          cache: 'npm'
      - name: install
        run: npm ci
      - name: build
        run: npm run build
      - name: test
        run: npm test
      - name: lint
        run: npm run lint```

on: push

jobs:
  build-and-test:

    name: test
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3

```yaml # Don't try to modify CI files. Edit src/lib/CreateAndSubmitGithubCI.jl in Julia.
#
# This GitHub Action invokes an action called actions/checkout and actions/checkout,
# both under the julia-actions org. The specified action is called with
# a 2nd positional argument, `setup-julia`. Its action runs with the 1st positional
# argument, `actions/checkout`. The `actions/checkout` action runs with a 2nd
# positional argument, `setup-julia`. That argument's 1st positional argument is
# also a 2nd positional argument, `setup-julia`. The 1st argument to the 2nd positional
# argument is `julia-action/setup-julia`.
# https://github.com/julia-actions/setup-julia

name: Master - CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [master]

jobs:
  test:
    name: Julia ${{ matrix.julia-version }} - ${{ matrix.os }}
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        os: [ubuntu-22.04]
        # Note: core packages are specified as a list in order to pass coverage across Julia 1.9.0.0
        # and prior versions (possibly updating them to at least Julia 1.9.0.0).
        # julialang/nbrequire does not install properly if using version 1.7 of Core.*
        # core-packages specifies the Core.* packages that are used to generate JLD2
        # files and nbrequire requires Core.*
        # julia-language/nbcheck requires Core.* packages and causes Core.* issues
        # so those packages are excluded here and included below in separate
        # matrix.applications lines.
        core-packages: [Core, Serialization, DataFrames, Test, Interpolations, DocStringExtensions, Markdown]
        applications:
          - julia-nightly
          # - julia
        julia-version: [1.9.0, 1.9.1, 1.9.2, 1.9.3, 1.10.0]
        julia-arch: [x86_64, arm64]
        all-nbtest: [false]
        coverage: [true]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
        with:
          submodules: recursive
          persist-credentials: true

      - uses: julia-actions/setup-julia@latest
        with:
          version: ${{ matrix.julia-version }}
          juliaArch: ${{ matrix.julia-arch }}
          setupAction: "setup-julia"
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-buildpkg@latest
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-runtest@latest
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-processcoverage@latest

      # If test coverage should be computed,
      # then use `--skip-coverage` to run Julia tests to trigger coverage.
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-processcoverage@latest
        with:
          script: if ${{ !matrix.all-nbtest }} && ${{ matrix.coverage }}
                then runtest(test_coverage)
            end
          override_coverage: true
          jld2_files: src/lib/, julia-language/juliastudio-ws/

      - uses: codecov/codecov-action@v1
        with:
          token: ${{ secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN }}
```

```yaml name: Master - CI

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - master
    schedule:
      - cron: 0 * * * *
jobs:
  test:
    name: Julia ${{ matrix.julia-version }} - ${{ matrix.os }}
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.os }}
    strategy:
      matrix:
        julia-version: ['1', 'nightly']
        julia-arch: [x64]
        os: [ubuntu-latest, windows-latest, macOS-latest]

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - uses: julia-actions/setup-julia@latest

        with:
          version: ${{ matrix.julia-version }}
          arch: ${{ matrix.julia-arch }}
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-buildpkg@latest
        env:
          PYTHON: ""
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-runtest@latest
        continue-on-error: ${{ matrix.julia-version == 'nightly' }}
        env:
          PYTHON: ""
      - uses: julia-actions/julia-processcoverage@v1
      - uses: codecov/codecov-action@v1
        with:
          file: ./lcov.info
          flags: unittests
          name: codecov-umbrella
          fail_ci_if_error: false
          token: ${{ secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN }}

name: CodeQL

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - dev
      - master
  pull_request:
    # Only receive PRs that target the dev branch
    branches:
      - dev
  schedule:
    - cron: 0 2 4 * * # At 2:40am every Thursday
  # This next config is only necessary if you have issues labeled 'bug'
  issues:
    types: [created]
    filters:
      repo: microsoft/vscode
      types:
        - labeled

jobs:
  analyze:
    name: Analyze
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.language }}
    # 1145ms = 1145 ms = 1145 * 1000 ms = 1.145 s = 1.145 * 60 s = 60.7 s = 1 min 40.7 s
    timeout-minutes: 1
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        language: [ 'csharp' ]
    steps:
      - name: Cancel Previous Runs
        uses: styfle/cancel-workflow-action@0.11.0

      - name: Checkout repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Initialize CodeQL
        uses: github/codeql-action/init@v3
        with:
          languages: ${{ matrix.language }}
          # If you wish to only analyze some of your code, you can specify a pattern
          # relative to the root of the repository. For example
          # directory: path/to/directory

      - name: Setup .NET
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v2
        with:
          version: '6.x'

      - name: Restore
        run: |
          dotnet restore

      - name: Build
        run: dotnet build --configuration Release

      - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
        uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
        with:
          file_types: CSharp
          cache_key: ${{ runner.os }}-${{ matrix.language }}-${{ env.DOTNET }}
          cache: true
          secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      fail-fast: false

      uses: github/codeql-action/init@v2

    # Autobuild attempts to build any compiled languages  (C/C++, C#, or Java).
    # If this step fails, then you should remove it and run the build manually (see below)
    - name: Setup .NET
      uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v3.0.3
      with:
        dotnet-version: ${{ env.DOTNET }}
        include-prerelease: ${{ env.DOTNET_PRERELEASE }}
    - name: Restore
      run: dotnet restore
    - name: Build

```yaml name: Publish

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - "master"

jobs:
  pages:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3

      - name: Use Node.js 16.x
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 16.x

      - name: Install and build examples
        run: yarn

      - name: Build documentation 📦
        run: npm run build:docs

      - name: Checkout gh-pages
        uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          ref: gh-pages
          path: pages

      - name: Build examples 📦
        run: npm run build:examples

      - name: Copy files to pages 📦
        run: |
          # Remove odd files
          rm -f examples/rollup.config.js
          rm -rf examples/NodePKCS12Example
          rm -rf examples/**/*.ts
          rm -rf examples/**/*.md

          # copy docs to pages
          rm -rf pages/docs
          cp -r docs pages

          # copy examples to pages
          rm -rf pages/examples
          cp -r examples pages

      - name: Deploy 🚀
        uses: JamesIves/github-pages-deploy-action@v4.3.0
        with:
          branch: gh-pages
          folder: pages

```yaml name: "Pre-review Tests"

on: [push, pull_request]

jobs:
  static-checks:
    runs-on: ubuntu-22.04

    steps:
    - name: Checkout
      uses: actions/checkout@v3
      with:
        # Checkout using commit hash to make "no-commit-to-branch" test pass.
        ref: ${{ github.sha }}

    - name: Setup Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      id: setup-python
      with:
        python-version: '3.8'

    - name: Setup cache
      uses: actions/cache@v3
      with:
        path: ~/.cache
        key: static-checks-${{ steps.setup-python.outputs.python-version }}-${{ hashFiles('.pre-commit-config.yaml') }}

    - name: Setup pre-commit
      run: |
        pip install pre-commit

    - name: Check
      run: |
        pre-commit run -a --show-diff-on-failure

  build-cuda:
    runs-on: ubuntu-22.04
    env:
      CUPY_CI: GitHub

    steps:
    - name: Checkout
      uses: actions/checkout@v3
      with:
        submodules: recursive

    - name: Setup Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      with:
        # cupyx.array_api uses Python 3.8 syntaxes
        python-version: '3.8'

    - name: Load ccache
      uses: actions/cache@v3
      with:
        path: ~/.ccache
        key: ccache-${{ github.sha }}
        restore-keys: ccache-${{ github.event_name == 'pull_request' && github.event.pull_request.base.sha || github.sha }}

    - name: Setup ccache
      run: |
        sudo apt-get update -y
        sudo apt-get install -y ccache
        echo "PATH=/usr/lib/ccache:${PATH}" >> "${GITHUB_ENV}"
        ccache --max-size 0.5Gi --cleanup --show-stats

    - name: Build
      run: |
        pip install -U pip wheel
        pip install cython
        READTHEDOCS=True pip install -v -e .

    - name: Docs Build
      run: |
        # Test to detect invalid escape sequences in docstrings (#1619)
        python -Werror::DeprecationWarning -m compileall -f -q cupy cupyx examples tests docs
        pushd docs
        pip install -r requirements.txt
        SPHINXOPTS="-W --keep-going -j 4" make html
        popd

  build-rocm:
    runs-on: ubuntu-22.04

    steps:
    - name: Checkout
      uses: actions/checkout@v3
      with:
        submodules: recursive

    - name: Build & Test
      run: |
        docker run --rm -v "${PWD}:/src" -w /src "rocm/dev-ubuntu-20.04:5.0-complete" bash .github/workflows/pretest-rocm-test.sh

```yaml # Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation.
# Licensed under the MIT License.

name: Coyote CI
on:
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
    paths-ignore:
      - 'docs/**'
      - '**.md'
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]
    paths-ignore:
      - 'docs/**'
      - '**.md'
  workflow_dispatch:
    branches: [ main ]
jobs:
  build-and-test:
    name: Build and test Coyote
    strategy:
      matrix:
        platform: [ windows-latest, ubuntu-latest, macos-latest ]
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.platform }}
    env:
      COYOTE_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT: 1
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Setup NuGet.exe
        uses: NuGet/setup-nuget@v1
        with:
          nuget-version: '6.x'
      - name: Setup .NET 6.0 SDK
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v1
        with:
          dotnet-version: '6.0.x'
      - name: Setup .NET Core 3.1 SDK
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v1
        with:
          dotnet-version: '3.1.x'
      - name: Setup debugging tools
        if: ${{ matrix.platform == 'windows-latest' }}
        run: |
          Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://download.sysinternals.com/files/Procdump.zip -OutFile Procdump.zip
          7z x .\Procdump.zip -oexternal && rm Procdump.zip
          echo "PROCDUMP_PATH=$pwd\external" | Out-File -FilePath $Env:GITHUB_ENV -Encoding utf8 -Append
        shell: pwsh
      - name: Build Coyote projects
        run: ./Scripts/build.ps1 -ci -nuget
        shell: pwsh
      - name: Validate Coyote rewriting
        if: ${{ matrix.platform == 'windows-latest' }}
        run: ./Tests/compare-rewriting-diff-logs.ps1
        shell: pwsh
      - name: Run Coyote tests
        run: ./Scripts/run-tests.ps1 -ci
        shell: pwsh
      - name: Archive Coyote binaries
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: coyote-binaries
          path: ./bin
      - name: Archive test results
        if: failure()
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: coyote-test-results
          path: ./Tests/**/TestResults
  build-and-test-samples:
    name: Build and test Coyote samples
    needs: build-and-test
    strategy:
      matrix:
        platform: [ windows-latest, ubuntu-latest, macos-latest ]
    runs-on: ${{ matrix.platform }}
    env:
      COYOTE_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT: 1
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Setup .NET 6.0 SDK
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v1
        with:
          dotnet-version: '6.0.x'
      - name: Download Coyote binaries
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: coyote-binaries
          path: ./bin
      - name: Build Coyote samples
        run: |
          ./Samples/Scripts/build.ps1 -local -nuget
          ./Samples/Scripts/build-tests.ps1 -local -nuget
        shell: pwsh
      - name: Test Coyote samples
        run: ./Samples/Scripts/run-tests.ps1
        shell: pwsh
```

```yaml name: CI

on:
  pull_request:
    paths-ignore:
      - 'docs/**'
  push:
    branches:
      - main
      - beta
    paths-ignore:
      - 'docs/**'

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Use Node.js 16.x
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 16.x
      - name: Cache Node.js modules
        uses: actions/cache@v2.1.7
        with:
          path: ~/.npm # npm cache files are stored in `~/.npm` on Linux/macOS
          key: ${{ runner.OS }}-node-16.x-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.OS }}-node-16.x
            ${{ runner.OS }}-
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      - name: Lint the code
        run: npm run lint --if-present
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    strategy:
      matrix:
        node-version: [12.x, 14.x, 16.x]

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Use Node.js ${{ matrix.node-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: ${{ matrix.node-version }}
      - name: Cache Node.js modules
        uses: actions/cache@v2.1.7
        with:
          path: ~/.npm # npm cache files are stored in `~/.npm` on Linux/macOS
          key: ${{ runner.OS }}-node-${{ matrix.node-version }}-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.OS }}-node-${{ matrix.node-version }}
            ${{ runner.OS }}-
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci
      - name: Build the project
        run: npm run build --if-present
      - name: Run tests
        run: npm run test:cov
        env:
          CI: true
      - name: Upload code coverage
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v2.1.0
        if: matrix.node-version == '16.x'
        with:
          token: ${{ secrets.CODECOV_TOKEN }}
          name: Node.js ${{ matrix.node-version }}
          flags: unittests

#
# This workflow should run whenever the source files change, or for
# significant release types if versioning of the plugin is
# enabled. The release type is controlled via the release_type input
# which must be supplied.

name: "Deploy to WordPress.org"
on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      release_type:
        description: "release type"
        required: true
        type: choice
        options:
          - "major"
          - "minor"
          - "patch"
jobs:
  tag:
    name: "Checkout repo"
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: "16"
      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm run build
    env:
      NODE_ENV: production

  # Update version and changelog before the release
  update-version:
    name: "Update version and changelog"
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: [ "tag" ]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
      - uses: 10up/action-wordpress-plugin-deploy@stable
        with:
          user: ${{ secrets.SVN_USERNAME }}
          password: ${{ secrets.SVN_PASSWORD }}
          repo: nfr/multi-craft
          branch: master
      - uses: 10up/action-wordpress-plugin-asset-update@stable
        with:

          new_tag: "${{ steps.update-version.outputs.NEW_TAG }}"
          new_version: "${{ steps.update-version.outputs.NEW_VERSION }}"
          version_changed: "false"
          plugin_is_private: "false"
          plugin_supports_l10n: "false"
          no_deprecated_warning: "false"
        env:
          NODE_ENV: production
        continue-on-error: true

  # Create Release
  create-release:
    name: "Create Relase"
    needs: "update-version"

    steps:

      - uses: 10up/action-wordpress-plugin-deploy@stable
        with:
          user: ${{ secrets.SVN_USERNAME }}
          password: ${{ secrets.SVN_PASSWORD }}
          repo: nfr/multi-craft
          branch: master
          local_assets: "path/to/path"
          local_media: "path/to/path"
          change_log: "${{ steps.update-version.outputs.CHANGELOG }}"
          new_tag: "${{ steps.update-version.outputs.NEW_TAG }}"
          new_version: "${{ steps.update-version.outputs.NEW_VERSION }}"
          plugin_is_private: "false"
          plugin_supports_l10n: "false"
          no_deprecated_warning: "false"
        env:
          NODE_ENV: production
        continue-on-error: true

  # Create Block Theme Plugin Deploy to WordPress.org
  create-block-theme-plugin:
    name: "Create Block Theme Plugin Deploy to WordPress.org"
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: "update-version"
    if: "!startsWith(github.event.inputs.release_type, 'patch')"
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3

          plugin_is_private: "false"
          plugin_supports_l10n: "false"
          no_deprecated_warning: "false"

          NODE_ENV: production
        continue-on-error: true

```yaml name: Deploy to WordPress.org

# Controls when the action will run. Workflow runs when manually triggered using the UI
# or API.
on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      release_type:
        description: 'Release type'
        required: true
        type: choice
        options:
        - major
        - minor
        - patch
jobs:
  tag:
    name: Checkout repo
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0
    
    - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
      with:
        node-version: 18
      
    - name: Install node dependencies
      run: npm install

    - name: Compile Javascript App
      run: npm run build

    - name: Update version and changelog
      id: update-version
      env:
        RELEASE_TYPE: ${{ github.event.inputs.release_type }}
      run: npm run update-version

    - name: Create Relase
      env:
        GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      run: |
        git config user.name github-actions
        git config user.email github-actions@github.com
        git config --global --add --bool push.autoSetupRemote true
        git diff-index --quiet HEAD -- || ( git add package.json readme.txt create-block-theme.php && git commit -m "Version bump & changelog update" && git push )
        gh release create ${{steps.update-version.outputs.NEW_TAG }} --notes "${{steps.update-version.outputs.CHANGELOG }}"

    - name: Create Block Theme Plugin Deploy to WordPress.org
      uses: 10up/action-wordpress-plugin-deploy@stable
      env:
        SVN_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.SVN_PASSWORD }}
        SVN_USERNAME: ${{ secrets.SVN_USERNAME }}
        VERSION: ${{ steps.update-version.outputs.NEW_VERSION }}
        
    - name: WordPress.org plugin asset/readme update
      uses: 10up/action-wordpress-plugin-asset-update@stable
      env:
        SVN_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.SVN_PASSWORD }}
        SVN_USERNAME: ${{ secrets.SVN_USERNAME }}

        with:

          registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'

      - name: Reset Deps
        run: |
          # This is just a guard against unwanted changes to the git history

          if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
            echo "Detected changes; skipping git reset..."
            exit 0
          fi

          git fetch
          git checkout -- workspaces/config/**/*
          git reset --hard origin/main

        with:

          # This is just a guard against unwanted changes to the git history
          # we've already made changes locally.
          if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
            echo "Detected changes; skipping git reset..."
            exit 0
          fi

          rm -rf node_modules yarn.lock
          git fetch
          git checkout -- workspaces/config/**/*
          git reset --hard origin/main
        shell: bash

      - name: Add Problem Matcher
        run: npm ci && npm run add-problem-matchers
      - name: Test
        env:
          MARK_DYNALOADER_INSTALLER: ''
        run: npm ci && npm run test

      - name: Check Git Status
        run: |
          if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
            echo "Detected changes; skipping Git Status Check..."
          else
            echo "Git Status is Good."
          fi

```yaml name: OpenOSRS - Scraper

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: 0 0 * * *

jobs:
  scrape-npcs:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2.4.2
        with:
          repository: open-osrs/cache-client
          ref: master
          path: cache-client

      - name: Set up JDK 11
        uses: actions/setup-java@v3.1.1
        with:
          distribution: 'adopt'
          java-version: 11
          cache: 'gradle'

      - name: Make gradlew executable
        run: chmod +x ./gradlew
        working-directory: cache-client

      - name: Assembling cache client
        run: ./gradlew assemble --console=plain
        working-directory: cache-client

      - name: Downloading jagex cache
        run: ./gradlew download --console=plain
        working-directory: cache-client

      - uses: actions/checkout@v2.4.2
        with:
          repository: open-osrs/runelite
          ref: master
          path: OpenOSRS

      - name: Make gradlew executable
        run: chmod +x ./gradlew
        working-directory: OpenOSRS

      - name: Assembling scraper
        run: ./gradlew :wiki-scraper:assemble --console=plain
        working-directory: OpenOSRS

      - name: Building cache client
        run: ./gradlew build --console=plain
        working-directory: cache-client

      - name: Building scraper
        run: ./gradlew :wiki-scraper:build --console=plain
        working-directory: OpenOSRS

      - name: Scraping NPC stats
        run: ./gradlew :wiki-scraper:npcStatsScrape --console=plain
        working-directory: OpenOSRS

      - name: Create NPC stats Pull Request
        uses: peter-evans/create-pull-request@v3.4.1
        with:
          token: ${{ secrets.OpenOSRS }}
          path: /home/runner/work/runelite/runelite/OpenOSRS
          author: OpenOSRS <openosrs.github@gmail.com>
          committer: OpenOSRS <openosrs.github@gmail.com>
          branch: NPC-UPDATE
          commit-message: 'client: Update NPC stats'
          title: 'client: Update NPC stats'
          body: This is an auto-generated PR with changes from the OSRS wiki
          labels: automated-pull-request, NPC stats
          signoff: false

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
      - 'stable-*'
      - '*'
    tags:
      - '*'
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 13 * * *'
concurrency:
  group: docs-push-{{ github.sha }}
  cancel-in-progress: true
jobs:
  build-docs:
    name: Build Ansible Docs
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: publish-docs-gh-pages
    permissions:
      pages: write
      contents: write
    steps:
      - name: Setup NodeJS
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '16.x'
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          yarn
          yarn docs:prepare
          yarn docs:fix-links
      - name: Setup static site builder
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '16.x'
      - name: Build
        run: |
          yarn docs:build
      - name: Upload artifact
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: docs-${{ needs.build-docs.outputs.artifact-name }}
          path: docs/build
  publish-docs-gh-pages:
    name: Publish Ansible Docs
    needs: build-docs
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Install Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: '16.x'
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          yarn
      - name: Setup GitHub Pages
        uses: actions/setup-pages@v3
        with:
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          repo-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          https-user: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_USERNAME }}
          https-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      - name: Copy docs from local
        run: |
          cp -rf docs/build public
      - name: Create public directory
        run: mkdir -p public
      - name: Upload artifacts
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
        with:
          name: gh-pages
          path: public
        # if (needs.build-docs.outputs.artifact-name !== 'api-docs')
        # then exit 1
        if: always()
        continue-on-error: true
        with:
          path: public
        if: ${{ needs.build-docs.outputs.artifact-name !== 'api-docs' }}
        continue-on-error: true
        with:
          path: docs/build
        if: ${{ needs.build-docs.outputs.artifact-name === 'api-docs' }}
      - name: Check GitHub Pages (access to API required)
        if: always()
        run: |
          curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/ansible/ansible/contributing -s --location -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" | jq .allow_wiki_edit > /dev/null
          if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
            echo "fail to check if contributor pages are available"
            echo "edit permissions are required to use GitHub Actions"
            exit 1
          fi
      - name: Create wiki on GitHub
        if: always()
        run: |
          curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/ansible/ansible/contributing -s --location -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" -X POST -d @.github/workflows/release-wiki.yml -H "Authorization: token ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}"
      - name: Update wiki
        if: always()
        run: |
          curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/ansible/ansible/contributing -s --location -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" -X PATCH -d '{"permission": "write"}' -H "Authorization: token ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}"
      - name: Set a cron job for auto-deploying (or use zero-day)
        if: always()
        run: |
          cat <<EOF | base64 -w 0 -i
          {{ actions_job_publish_docs_gh_pages.steps[0].run | substitute(["\n", " "]) }}
          EOF | base64 -w 0
          | while IFS=':' read -r cron_job
          do
            curl -s "https://api.github.com/repos/ansible/ansible/pull-requests" -s --location -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" -X POST -d "{\"title\": \"build and deploy\",\n\"body\": \"This PR is automatically built and deployed by the [Ansible action](`.github/workflows/_shared-docs-build-push.yml`). \nBefore updating the schedule, you may need to create a GitHub Wiki [here].\n\n[Ansible action]: https://github.com/ansible-community/github-docs-build/actions/workflows/_shared-docs-build-push.yml\n[here]: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/contributing\n\`\`\`\n# {{username}} builds and deploys into `{{ target }}`.\n# Target value is the branch name. Default is 'main'.\n{{ cron_job | substitute("\n", " ") }}\n\`\`\`\"}" -H "Authorization: token ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}"
          done < ./docs/schedule-wiki.md
      - name: Check if schedule creation succeeded
        if: always()
        run: |
          curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/ansible/ansible/pull-requests | grep "create_schedule\|[[:space:]]$"
          if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
            echo "please confirm that `create_schedule` job was successfully run"
            echo "create_schedule job failed"
            exit 1
          fi
      - name: Set up schedule
        if: always()
        run: |
          curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/ansible/ansible/pull-requests | grep "schedule\|[[:space:]]$"
          if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
            echo "please confirm that `schedule` job was successfully run"
            echo "schedule job failed"
            exit 1
          fi
      - name: Set GitHub Pages URL
        if: always()
        run: |
          https://api.github.com/repos/ansible/ansible/contributing -s --location -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" -X PATCH -d '{"primary_slug": "api-docs"}' -H "Authorization: token ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}"
      - name: Try GitHub Pages URL
        if: always()
        run: |
          curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/ansible/ansible/contributing -s --location -H "Accept: application/vnd.github.v3+json" | jq .primary_slug > /dev/null
          if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
            echo "please confirm that API route `/contributing` exists"

      - name: Push CI results to status page

      - name: Set page status

          if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then

```yaml name: Collection Docs
concurrency:
  group: docs-push-${{ github.sha }}
  cancel-in-progress: true
on:
  push:
    branches:
    - main
    - stable-*
    tags:
    - '*'
  schedule:
  - cron: '0 13 * * *'

jobs:
  build-docs:
    permissions:
      contents: read
    name: Build Ansible Docs
    uses: ansible-community/github-docs-build/.github/workflows/_shared-docs-build-push.yml@main
    with:
      init-lenient: true
      init-fail-on-error: true
      extra-collections: 'git+https://github.com/ansible-collections/amazon.aws.git,main'
      intersphinx-links: |
        amazon_aws:https://ansible-collections.github.io/amazon.aws/branch/main/
        ansible_devel:https://docs.ansible.com/ansible-core/devel/

  publish-docs-gh-pages:
    # use to prevent running on forks
    if: github.repository == 'ansible-collections/community.aws'
    permissions:
      contents: write
    needs: [build-docs]
    name: Publish Ansible Docs
    uses: ansible-community/github-docs-build/.github/workflows/_shared-docs-build-publish-gh-pages.yml@main
    with:
      artifact-name: ${{ needs.build-docs.outputs.artifact-name }}
    secrets:
      GH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

name: checkstyle build

on:
  schedule:
# Every 5th minute every 3 hours during working days
    - cron: '5 */3 * * 1-5'
# Every 6 hours during weekends ... we don't want to be flooded with emails
    - cron: '30 */6 * * 6,0'

permissions:
  contents: read # to fetch code (actions/checkout)

jobs:
  build:
    if: github.repository == 'apache/camel'
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        java: [ '11' ]
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          persist-credentials: false
      - id: install-mvnd
        uses: ./.github/actions/install-mvnd
      - name: Set up JDK ${{ matrix.java }}
        uses: actions/setup-java@v3
        with:
          distribution: 'temurin'
          java-version: ${{ matrix.java }}
          cache: 'maven'
      - name: mvn sourcecheck
        run: ${{ steps.install-mvnd.outputs.mvnd-dir }}/mvnd -l checkstyle.log -Dmvnd.threads=2 -V -Dhttp.keepAlive=false -Dmaven.wagon.http.pool=false -Dmaven.wagon.httpconnectionManager.ttlSeconds=120 --no-transfer-progress -Psourcecheck -Dcheckstyle.failOnViolation=true -e -DskipTests checkstyle:checkstyle verify

    - name: Login to Docker Hub

      run: |
        # Avoid running "docker buildx ls" inside of a GitHub Actions job due to #11721
        for platform in ${{ steps.buildx.outputs.platforms }}; do
          echo "Running \"docker buildx create --use --platform $platform\""

    - name: Run GoReleaser

            platform=arm64

          - target=linux
            platform=386

            platform=mips64le
            bin=phar

name: autoupdate

```yaml name: Publish

on:
  push:
    branches-ignore:
      # No canary deploys for branches opened by dependabot
      - "dependabot/**"

jobs:
  publish:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: "!contains(github.event.head_commit.message, 'ci skip') && !contains(github.event.head_commit.message, 'skip ci')"

    name: Make a release and publish to NPM
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          cache: "yarn"
        env:
          NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}

      - name: Install Node dependencies
        run: yarn --frozen-lockfile

      # don't use yarn run to avoid using yarnpkg registry
      - name: Create release
        run: npm run release
        env:
          NPM_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

      - name: Extract OpenWrt Firmware

answer:
```yaml name: ARMv8 Docker BuildX

on:
  workflow_dispatch:
  schedule:
    - cron: 0 1 * * 6

env:
  REPO_URL: https://github.com/coolsnowwolf/lede
  REPO_BRANCH: master
  DOCKER_BUILD: buildImageX.sh
  DOCKER_IMAGE: summary/openwrt-aarch64
  TZ: Asia/Shanghai

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-22.04

    steps:
    - name: Checkout
      uses: actions/checkout@main

    - name: Extract OpenWrt Version
      run: |
        git clone $REPO_URL -b $REPO_BRANCH openwrt
        cd $GITHUB_WORKSPACE/openwrt
        version=$(echo "$(cat package/lean/default-settings/files/zzz-default-settings)" | grep -Po "DISTRIB_REVISION=\'\K[^\']*")
        echo "TAG=$version" >> $GITHUB_ENV

    - name: Extract OpenWrt Firmware
      run: |
        cd $GITHUB_WORKSPACE/docker
        wget -q $(curl -s "https://api.github.com/repos/$GITHUB_REPOSITORY/releases" | grep "ARMv8_Docker.*rootfs.tar.gz" | cut -d '"' -f 4)
        chmod +x $DOCKER_BUILD && ./$DOCKER_BUILD

    - name: Set up QEMU
      uses: docker/setup-qemu-action@master

    - name: Set up Docker Buildx
      uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@master

    - name: Login to Docker Hub
      uses: docker/login-action@master
      with:
         username: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}
         password: ${{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}

on:
  push:
    branches: [ 'master', 'next' ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ 'master' ]

jobs:
  analyze:
    name: Analyze
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      actions: read
      contents: read
      security-events: write

    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        language: [ 'cpp' ]
        # limit to only supported version for now
        codacy: [ true, false ]
        # default to true when matrix.language == cpp, but override in case it's disabled
        # see https://github.com/github/codeql-action/pull/153 for why this is
        analyzer-enabled: [ true, false ]
        # disable CodeQL autounit runner when analyzer-disabled is true
        autounit-enabled: [ true, false ]

    steps:
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v3

    - name: Initialize CodeQL
      uses: github/codeql-action/init@v2
      with:
        languages: ${{ matrix.language }}
        # Automatically create issues for security issues
        # When the severity level of a secret stored in a secret stored in a
        # CodeQL query is HIGH or CRITICAL, GitHub will open a new issue or add
        # a security label to the pull request.
        auto-create-issue: true

    - name: Autobuild
      uses: github/codeql-action/autobuild@v2

    - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
      with:
        # Add other CodeQL tools if needed
        # tools: dotnet

        # Disable analysis if build succeeds, but leave the workflow in a "failure" state
        # if the previous step's exit code is not 0
        path-exclusions: build/**, test/**, .vs/**, **/.git, .github/**, .vscode/**, dist/**, docs/**, scripts/**
        fail-build-success: ${{ matrix.analyzer-enabled }}
        fail-on-warning: ${{ !matrix.analyzer-enabled }}

        # Disable CodeQL autounit runner when analyzers are disabled
        autounit-enabled: ${{ matrix.analyzer-enabled }}
        autounit-exclude-regex: |-
          ^${{ matrix.analyzer-enabled }}\.

        # If CodeQL support is disabled for a language, disable the repository entirely
        if-no-results: ${{ !matrix.analyzer-enabled }}

```yaml # This workflow warns and then closes issues and PRs that have had no activity for a specified amount of time.
#
# You can adjust the behavior by modifying this file.
# For more information, see:
# https://github.com/actions/stale
name: "Close stale issues and PRs"

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: "30 1 * * *" # At 01:30

permissions:
  issues: write
  pull-requests: write

jobs:
  stale:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/stale@v6
        with:
          days-before-issue-stale: -1
          days-before-issue-close: -1 # never closed automatically
          stale-pr-message: "This PR is stale because it has been open 172 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment or this will be closed in 10 days."
          close-pr-message: "This PR was closed because it has been stalled for 10 days with no activity."
          days-before-pr-stale: 172
          days-before-pr-close: 10
          stale-pr-label: "no-pr-activity"
          exempt-pr-labels: "awaiting-approval,work-in-progress"
          exempt-draft-pr: true
```

concurrency:
  group: nightly-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: true

jobs:

  backend-tests:
    name: Backend Server Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        python-version:
          - 3.8
          - 3.9
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
        uses: actions/setup-python@v3
        with:
          python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}
          cache: pip
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          pip install -r requirements.txt
      - name: Install dev dependencies
        run: |
          pip install -r dev-requirements.txt
      - name: Run tests
        run: |
          ./test-local.sh
          pip install requests
          pip install pytest==5.4.3
          pytest -vv tests/test_main.py -v tests/test_api.py -v tests/test_http.py

  frontend-tests:
    name: Frontend and End-to-End Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v2
        with:
          node-version: 14
      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          npm ci --only=production --ignore-scripts
          npx ts-node -P tsconfig.development.json --plugin @nrwl/workspace cypress/support/e2e.json
          cp -r packages/$NIGHTLY_SERVER/libs/api/dist/* dist/api/

  build-release:
    name: Build Tagged Release
    needs: [backend-tests, frontend-tests]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - uses: ilshidur/action-discord@0.3.2
        with:
          token: ${{ secrets.DISCORD_NIGHTLY_WEBHOOK }}
          content: |-
            Build started:

            ✅ ${{ github.ref }}
            ✅ ${{ matrix.python-version }}
            ✅ ${{ github.event.tag }}
            ✅ ${{ github.event_name }}

            @eciaspinola @medhinabnabi
          ephemeral: true
      - name: Run CI on CI Server
        run: |
          python -m pytest --strict pytest/ci/ci-test.yaml

  notify-discord:
    name: Notify Discord
    needs: [frontend-tests]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: appleboy/ssh-action@master
        with:
          host: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_IP }}
          username: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_USER }}
          key: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_SSH_KEY }}
          port: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_PORT }}
          no-pty: true
          enable-pty: false
          timeout: 10000
          retries: 2
          username: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_USER }}
          password: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_SSH_KEY }}
          run: |
            echo '============================' >> $HOME/user-agent.log && \
            cat $HOME/.netlify/dev-tools/.tmp/device/user-agent.txt >> $HOME/user-agent.log && \
            cat $HOME/user-agent.log | docker logs -f -n 20000 $CONTAINER_ID >> $HOME/user-agent.log && \
            echo '============================' >> $HOME/user-agent.log
      - uses: appleboy/ssh-action@master
        with:
          host: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_IP }}
          username: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_USER }}
          key: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_SSH_KEY }}
          port: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_PORT }}
          no-pty: true
          enable-pty: false
          timeout: 10000
          retries: 2
          username: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_USER }}
          password: ${{ secrets.DEMO_SERVER_SSH_KEY }}
          run: |
            echo ${{ secrets.NIGHTLY_SERVER_DEMO_APP_TOKEN }} | \
            docker run -d -e NIGHTLY_SERVER_DEMO_APP_TOKEN=${{ secrets.NIGHTLY_SERVER_DEMO_APP_TOKEN }} \
              -v $HOME/nginx:/etc/nginx/conf.d \
              -v $HOME/nginx:/usr/share/nginx/html \
              -v $HOME/user-agent.log:/var/log/nginx/access.log \
              -v $HOME/user-agent.log:/var/log/nginx/error.log \

          token: ${{ secrets.DISCORD_NIGHTLY_WEBHOOK }}
          content: |-
            Demo deployment started:

            ✅ ${{ github.ref }}
            ✅ ${{ matrix.python-version }}
            ✅ ${{ github.event.tag }}
            ✅ ${{ github.event_name }}

            @eciaspinola @medhinabnabi
          ephemeral: true
      - name: Update Frontend
        run: |
          docker run -d --rm \
            -e NIGHTLY_SERVER_DEMO_APP_TOKEN=${{ secrets.NIGHTLY_SERVER_DEMO_APP_TOKEN }} \
            -v $HOME/nginx:/etc/nginx/conf.d \
            -v $HOME/nginx:/usr/share/nginx/html \

            -v $HOME/user-agent.log:/var/log/nginx/error.log \
            -p 10443:443 \

            medhinabnabi/medhinabnabi/mealie:demo
      - name: Build Demo
        run: |
          docker build -t medhinabnabi/medhinabnabi/mealie:demo . --build-arg DEPLOY_ENV=LOCAL_DEMO

        os: [ubuntu-latest]
        python-version: [3.9]

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v3
    - name: Set up Python ${{ matrix.python-version }}
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      with:
        python-version: ${{ matrix.python-version }}

    - name: Install dependencies
      run: |
        make develop
        python -m pip install -U wheel twine setuptools

    - name: Lint
      run: |
        make lint

    - name: Test
      run: |
        make test

    - name: Package and check
      run: |
        python setup.py sdist bdist_wheel
        python -m twine check dist/*

    - name: Publish distribution 📦 to PyPI
      if: startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/tags')
      env:
        TWINE_USERNAME: ${{ secrets.PYPI_UN }}
        TWINE_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.PYPI_PW }}
      run: |
        python -m twine upload dist/* --skip-existing

```yaml # Publishing of unit test results has to be a separate workflow in order to support forked PRs
# See https://github.com/EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action#support-fork-repositories-and-dependabot-branches
name: Publish Test Results
on:
  workflow_run:
    workflows: [CI]
    types:
      - completed
jobs:
  test-results:
    name: Test Results
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.event.workflow_run.conclusion != 'skipped'

    steps:
      - name: Download and Extract Artifacts
        env:
          GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN}}
        run: |
          mkdir -p artifacts && cd artifacts

          artifacts_url=${{ github.event.workflow_run.artifacts_url }}

          gh api "$artifacts_url" -q '.artifacts[] | [.name, .archive_download_url] | @tsv' | while read artifact
          do
            IFS=$'\t' read name url <<< "$artifact"
            gh api $url > "$name.zip"
            unzip -d "$name" "$name.zip"
          done

      - name: Publish Test Results
        uses: EnricoMi/publish-unit-test-result-action@v2
        with:
          commit: ${{ github.event.workflow_run.head_sha }}
          event_file: artifacts/Event File/event.json
          event_name: ${{ github.event.workflow_run.event }}
          junit_files: |
            artifacts/**/surefire-reports/*.xml
            artifacts/**/failsafe-reports/TEST-*.xml

# under the License.

# Attempt to cancel stale workflow runs to save github actions runner time
name: cancel

on:
  workflow_run:
    # The name of another workflow (whichever one) that always runs on PRs
    workflows: ['Dev']
    types: ['requested']

jobs:
  cancel-stale-workflow-runs:
    name: "Cancel stale workflow runs"
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      # Unfortunately, we need to define a separate cancellation step for
      # each workflow where we want to cancel stale runs.
      - uses: potiuk/cancel-workflow-runs@master
        name: "Cancel stale Dev runs"
        with:
          cancelMode: allDuplicates
          token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          workflowFileName: dev.yml
          skipEventTypes: '["push", "schedule"]'
      - uses: potiuk/cancel-workflow-runs@master
        name: "Cancel stale Integration runs"
        with:
          cancelMode: allDuplicates
          token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          workflowFileName: integration.yml
          skipEventTypes: '["push", "schedule"]'
      - uses: potiuk/cancel-workflow-runs@master
        name: "Cancel stale Rust runs"
        with:
          cancelMode: allDuplicates
          token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          workflowFileName: rust.yml
          skipEventTypes: '["push", "schedule"]'

```yaml name: Nightly
on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      cmake_args:
        description: 'Extra CMake args'
  schedule:
    - cron:  '0 1 * * *'

jobs:
  CI:
    strategy:
      matrix:
        backend: ["OPENMP", "SERIAL"]
    runs-on: ubuntu-20.04
    container:
      image: ghcr.io/ecp-copa/ci-containers/ubuntu:latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout kokkos
        uses: actions/checkout@v2.2.0
        with:
          repository: kokkos/kokkos
          ref: develop
          path: kokkos
      - name: Build kokkos
        working-directory: kokkos
        run: |
          cmake -B build -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$HOME/kokkos -DKokkos_ENABLE_${{ matrix.backend }}=ON  -DKokkos_ENABLE_DEPRECATED_CODE_3=OFF
          cmake --build build --parallel 2
          cmake --install build
      - name: Checkout arborx
        uses: actions/checkout@v2.2.0
        with:
          repository: arborx/ArborX
          ref: master
          path: arborx
      - name: Build arborx
        working-directory: arborx
        run: |
          cmake -B build -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=${HOME}/kokkos -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$HOME/arborx
          cmake --build build --parallel 2
          cmake --install build
      - name: Checkout Cabana
        uses: actions/checkout@v2.2.0
      - name: Build Cabana
        run: |
          cmake -B build -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$HOME/Cabana -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH="$HOME/kokkos;$HOME/arborx" -DCabana_ENABLE_TESTING=ON -DCabana_ENABLE_EXAMPLES=ON -DCabana_REQUIRE_${{ matrix.backend }}=ON -DVALGRIND_EXECUTABLE=False ${{ github.event.inputs.cmake_args }}
          cmake --build build --parallel 2
          CTEST_OUTPUT_ON_FAILURE=yes cmake --build build --target test
          cmake --install build

```yaml name: e2e
on:
  pull_request:
  push:
    branches:
      - 'release-*'
      - 'master'
      - 'main'
    tags:
      - 'v*'
jobs:
  e2e-tests:
    name: E2E tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
        suite: [alertmanager, prometheus, prometheusAllNS, thanosruler, operatorUpgrade]
        include:
          - suite: alertmanager
            prometheus: "exclude"
            prometheusAllNS: "exclude"
            alertmanager: ""
            thanosruler: "exclude"
            operatorUpgrade: "exclude"
            featureGated: "include"
          - suite: prometheus
            prometheus: ""
            prometheusAllNS: "exclude"
            alertmanager: "exclude"
            thanosruler: "exclude"
            operatorUpgrade: "exclude"
            featureGated: "include"
          - suite: prometheusAllNS
            prometheus: "exclude"
            prometheusAllNS: ""
            alertmanager: "exclude"
            thanosruler: "exclude"
            operatorUpgrade: "exclude"
            featureGated: "include"
          - suite: thanosruler
            prometheus: "exclude"
            prometheusAllNS: "exclude"
            alertmanager: "exclude"
            thanosruler: ""
            operatorUpgrade: "exclude"
            featureGated: "include"
          - suite: operatorUpgrade
            prometheus: "exclude"
            prometheusAllNS: "exclude"
            alertmanager: "exclude"
            thanosruler: "exclude"
            operatorUpgrade: ""
            featureGated: "include"
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v3
    - name: Import environment variables from file
      run: cat ".github/env" >> $GITHUB_ENV
    - name: Install Go
      uses: actions/setup-go@v3
      with:
        go-version: '${{ env.golang-version }}'
    - name: Build images
      run: |
        export SHELL=/bin/bash
        make build image
    - name: Start KinD
      uses: engineerd/setup-kind@v0.5.0
      with:
        version: ${{ env.kind-version }}
        image: ${{ env.kind-image }}
        wait: 300s
        config: /test/e2e/kind-conf.yaml
    - name: Wait for cluster to finish bootstraping
      run: |
        kubectl wait --for=condition=Ready pods --all --all-namespaces --timeout=300s
        kubectl cluster-info
        kubectl get pods -A
    - name: Load images
      run: |
        kind load docker-image quay.io/prometheus-operator/prometheus-operator:$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)
        kind load docker-image quay.io/prometheus-operator/prometheus-config-reloader:$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)
        kind load docker-image quay.io/prometheus-operator/admission-webhook:$(git rev-parse --short HEAD)
        kubectl apply -f scripts/kind-rbac.yaml
    - name: Run tests
      run: >
        EXCLUDE_ALERTMANAGER_TESTS=${{ matrix.alertmanager }}
        EXCLUDE_PROMETHEUS_TESTS=${{ matrix.prometheus }}
        EXCLUDE_PROMETHEUS_ALL_NS_TESTS=${{ matrix.prometheusAllNS }}
        EXCLUDE_THANOSRULER_TESTS=${{ matrix.thanosruler }}
        EXCLUDE_OPERATOR_UPGRADE_TESTS=${{ matrix.operatorUpgrade }}
        FEATURE_GATED_TESTS=${{ matrix.featureGated }}
        make test-e2e

  # Added to summarize the matrix and allow easy branch protection rules setup
  e2e-tests-result:
    name: End-to-End Test Results
    if: always()
    needs:
      - e2e-tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Mark the job as a success
        if: needs.e2e-tests.result == 'success'
        run: exit 0
      - name: Mark the job as a failure
        if: needs.e2e-tests.result != 'success'
        run: exit 1
```

```yaml name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - master
      - renovate/*
    tags:
      - '*'
  pull_request:
  schedule:
    - cron:  '0 4 * * 5' # Fridays at 4am

jobs:
  test:
    name: Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Setup node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 12
      - name: Install dependencies
        uses: bahmutov/npm-install@v1
      - name: Lint
        run: yarn lint
      - name: Test
        run: yarn test:ember

  test-no-lock:
    name: Floating Dependencies
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs:
      - test
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Setup node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 12
      - name: Install dependencies
        uses: bahmutov/npm-install@v1
        with:
          useLockFile: false
      - name: Test
        run: yarn test:ember

  test-try:
    name: Scenario ${{ matrix.scenario }}, BS${{ matrix.bootstrap }}, ${{ matrix.browser}}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 10
    continue-on-error: ${{ matrix.allow-failure || false }}
    needs:
      - test
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
      matrix:
        allow-failure:
          - false
        scenario:
          - ember-lts-3.24
          - ember-lts-3.28
          - ember-release
          - ember-beta
          - ember-canary
          - ember-classic
          - embroider-safe
          - embroider-optimized
        bootstrap:
          - 4
          - 5
        browser:
          - Chrome
        include:
          - scenario: ember-release
            browser: Firefox
            bootstrap: 4
          - scenario: ember-release
            browser: Firefox
            bootstrap: 5
          - scenario: node-tests
    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - name: Setup node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 12
      - name: Install dependencies
        uses: bahmutov/npm-install@v1

answer:
```yaml name: "Nix & Meson: update version"

on: [workflow_dispatch]

jobs:
  update:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - name: Clone repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v3
    - name: Update flake and meson version
      run: |
        REGEX="([0-9]+(\.[0-9a-zA-Z]+)+)"

        CRT_REV=$(git show-ref --tags --head --abbrev | head -n 1 | head -c 7)
        TAG_REV=$(git show-ref --tags --abbrev | tail -n 1 | head -c 7)
        CRT_VER=$(sed -nEe "/$REGEX/{p;q;}" meson.build | awk -F\' '{print $2}')
        VERSION=$(git show-ref --tags --abbrev | tail -n 1 | tail -c +20)

        if [[ $TAG_REV = $CRT_REV ]] || [[ $CRT_VER != $VERSION ]]; then
          sed -Ei "s/$REGEX/$VERSION/g" meson.build
          sed -Ei "s/$REGEX/$VERSION/g" flake.nix
        fi
    - uses: stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action@v4
      with:
        commit_message: "[gha] bump flake and meson version"
```

answer:
```yaml name: Continuous

on:
  # PRs will be built, and a package posted to GH Packages
  pull_request:
  
  push:
    paths-ignore:
    - 'README.md'
    - 'docs/**'

    # We'll build, pack, and push a pre-release to NuGet on master
    branches: [ master ]

    # Tagging with v* will build that version number and push a release to Nuget
    #   e.g. v1.2, v3.4.5, etc.
    tags:
    - 'v*'

defaults:
  run:
    shell: pwsh

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v3

    - name: Setup .NET Core
      uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v3

  # Run unit tests
    - name: Test
      run: dotnet test --configuration Release --verbosity normal

  # Package Release
    - name: Pack
      run: |
        <# If we're a tag, force VersionPrefix to the tag value #>
        if ('${{ github.ref }}' -match '^refs/tags/v') {
          $match = [regex]::Match('${{ github.ref }}', '^refs/tags/v([0-9]+(\.[0-9]+){1,2})')
          if ($match.Success) {
            $env:VersionPrefix = $match.Groups[1].Value
          } else {
            throw 'Invalid tag version: ${{ github.ref }}'
          }
        }
        else {
          <# All other pushes get a CI suffix #>
          $env:VersionSuffix = 'ci{0:0000}' -f ${{ github.run_number }}
        }

        dotnet pack --configuration Release --verbosity normal --output .
    
    - name: Upload NuGet
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
      with:
        name: NuGet
        if-no-files-found: error
        path: |
          **/*.nupkg
          **/*.snupkg
      
  # Update the docs
    - name: Update Docs
      if: github.event_name == 'push'
      run: |
        dotnet tool install xmldocmd
        dotnet tool run xmldocmd .\Moq.AutoMock\bin\Release\net461\Moq.AutoMock.dll .\docs

        $modified = $(git status -u --porcelain)
        if ($modified.Where({$_.Contains(" docs/")}, 'First').Count -lt 1) {
          return 0
        }
        
  # Create docs pull request
    - name: Create Pull Request
      uses: peter-evans/create-pull-request@v4
      if: github.event_name == 'push'
      with:
        commit-message: |
          [Docs update detected by Github Action].
          Auto generated pull request.
        branch: docs/automated-update
        delete-branch: true
        base: master
        title: Update Docs [GitHub Action]
        body: |
          [Docs update detected by Github Action].
          Auto generated pull request.

  # Publish to NuGet and GitHub Packages
    - name: Publish
      if: github.event_name == 'push'
      run: |
        dotnet nuget push *.nupkg --source https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json --api-key ${{ secrets.NUGET_TOKEN }} --skip-duplicate
        dotnet nuget push *.nupkg `
          --source 'https://nuget.pkg.github.com/${{ github.repository_owner }}/index.json' `
          --api-key '${{ github.token }}' `
          --skip-duplicate

  automerge:
    if: github.event_name == 'pull_request'
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    permissions:
      pull-requests: write
      contents: write

    steps:
      - uses: fastify/github-action-merge-dependabot@v3.4.0  ```

        run: |
          sudo apt-get -y update
          rosdep update
          DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive rosdep install -y --from-paths src --ignore-src --rosdistro humble

```yaml #!/usr/bin/env bash

# Import variables from external files
source versionVariables.sh
source build_variables.sh

# Import Reusable workflow

# On PR opens or a pull_request_target event is triggered, only run the steps which matter in PR context
if [ "${{github.event_name}}" = "pull_request_target" ] || [ "${{github.event_name}}" = "pull_request" ]
then
  build_flag=""
  # Force default for this specific case
  [[ $trigger == "$BUILD_TRIGGER" ]] || build_flag="--build=true"

  # Use custom Dockerfactors for development
  if [ "$BRANCH" == "dev" ]
  then
    build_flag=""
    [[ $trigger == "$BUILD_TRIGGER" ]] || build_flag="--build=true"
    PR_PATTERN=${GITHUB_HEAD_REF//%2F\//-}
    PR_PATTERN=${PR_PATTERN//%/}
    versionTag=$PR_PATTERN$ANCHOR_TAG

    echo "Building Docker Container for Development Build. $versionTag"
    docker build $build_flag -t angr:$versionTag -t angr:latest .
    docker run --rm -v /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime angr:$versionTag bash
  else
    build_flag=""
    [[ $trigger == "$BUILD_TRIGGER" ]] || build_flag="--build=true"
    echo "Building Docker Container for Release Build. $versionTag"
    docker build $build_flag -t angr:$versionTag -t angr:latest .
  fi

  if [ "$ANSIBLE_BUILD" == "true" ]
  then
    # The release container requires 30s timeout due to lack of disk space on build folder
    docker build $build_flag -t angr:ansible-build -t angr:latest .
    docker run --rm -v /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime angr:ansible-build bash
  fi

  # If $RUN_DOCKER_GDB is defined, and the target uses dockerfile_gdb,
  # run the dockerfile_gdb test and use a new rootfs
  if [[ -n $RUN_DOCKER_GDB ]] && [[ -n $DOCKERFILE_GDB ]]
  then
    echo "Building a custom rootfs for GDB"
    mkdir custom-rootfs
    mkdir custom-rootfs/etc/lsb-release
    mkdir custom-rootfs/home/$USER/.config

    echo "lsb_release -a" > custom-rootfs/etc/lsb-release/lsb_release
    echo "VERSION_ID=\"$(lsb_release -cs)\"" >> custom-rootfs/etc/lsb-release/lsb_release
    echo "DISTRIB_ID=\"Debian\"" >> custom-rootfs/etc/lsb-release/lsb_release
    echo "DISTRIB_RELEASE=\"$(lsb_release -cs)\"" >> custom-rootfs/etc/lsb-release/lsb_release
    echo "DISTRIB_CODENAME=\"bullseye\"" >> custom-rootfs/etc/lsb-release/lsb_release

    mkdir custom-rootfs/home/$USER/.config
    cat $DISTRIB_ROOTFS/etc/skel/.config/*/* > custom-rootfs/home/$USER/.config

    pushd custom-rootfs
    docker build --target=build-gdb --build-arg='version_tag=$versionTag' -t angr:dev-gdb -f ../dockerfile_gdb .
    popd

    docker run -v $BUILD_ROOTFS:/tmp --rm -it -u $USER -e DOCKER_GDB_ARGS="-v $BUILD_ROOTFS:/tmp -w /tmp" -e VERSION_TAG="$versionTag" -e GDB_ARGS="--build-dir=$BUILD_ROOTFS -gdbserver $GDB_SERVER:$GDB_PORT" angr:dev-gdb bash
  fi
fi

# Build Dockerfiles
# This will add $BUILDFLAGS to the build parameters
if [ "$BUILDFLAGS" ]
then
  build_cmd="--build-arg='$BUILDFLAGS'"
fi

# Push image to Docker Hub
if [[ $GH_REF == *"-latest"* ]]; then
  # If the docker tag is a release tag, this will push the image to docker hub
  docker push angr:$VERSION_TAG
  docker push angr:latest
  docker push angr:$GITHUB_REPOSITORY
fi

# For any failing job, mark the PR as passing, so that PRs can continue to be merged to dev
if [ "$GITHUB_EVENT_NAME" == "pull_request" ]
then
  if [ "${{job.concurrency}} == "true" ]
  then
    echo "concurrency $CONCURRENCY_SPEC for PR ${{github.workflow}}/${{github.workflow}}-${{github.head_ref}}"
  fi

  if [[ $CONCURRENCY_SPEC == *"pr" ]]; then
    # Pull the release tag if it is present in the build env, otherwise fail
    if [ -z "$VERSION_TAG" ]; then
      echo "ERROR: Could not find the VERSION_TAG in the PR environment. This is expected if you are building for local development."
      echo "Please set the VERSION_TAG variable in the PR environment to a valid docker tag."
      echo "Examples: $VERSION_TAG=0.1.2, $VERSION_TAG=next-devel, $VERSION_TAG=develop, $VERSION_TAG=stable"
      echo "For more information, please check this article: https://help.github.com/en/articles/metadata-structures-for-github-actions"
      exit 1
    fi
    if [ -z "$PR_COMMITISH" ]; then
      echo "ERROR: PR_COMMITISH not set."
      echo "Pull request merging only supports a branch, such as main, dev, or 1.0.1"
      echo "For more information, please check this article: https://help.github.com/en/articles/metadata-structures-for-github-actions"
      exit 1
    fi

    echo "Publishing ${VERSION_TAG} to releases page"
    gh release create --push "${VERSION_TAG}" \
      --title "Release v$VERSION_TAG" \
      --description "### Version: $VERSION_TAG" \
      --add-assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname).tar.gz \
      --add-assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname).tgz \
      --add-assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname)-debug.tar.gz \
      --add-assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname)-debug.tgz \
      --add-assets ./dist/$PR_COMMITISH/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S).tar.gz \
      --add-assets ./dist/$PR_COMMITISH/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S).tgz \
      --add-assets ./dist/$PR_COMMITISH/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-debug.tar.gz \
      --add-assets ./dist/$PR_COMMITISH/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-debug.tgz \
      ./dist
  fi

  if [[ $CONCURRENCY_SPEC == *"stable" ]]; then
    # For this action to work, the user must set $VERSION_TAG and GH_REF to an appropriate tag
    echo "Publishing stable ${VERSION_TAG} to releases page"
    gh release create --push "${VERSION_TAG}" \
      --title "Release v$VERSION_TAG" \
      --description "### Version: $VERSION_TAG" \
      --add-assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S).tar.gz \
      --add-assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S).tgz \
      --add-assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-debug.tar.gz \
      --add-assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-debug.tgz \
      ./dist
  fi

  if [[ $CONCURRENCY_SPEC == *"master" ]]; then
    # Publish to releases page, but do not push changes to the registry
    gh release create --assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname).tar.gz \
      --assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname).tgz \
      --assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname)-debug.tar.gz \
      --assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname)-debug.tgz \
      --assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S).tar.gz \
      --assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S).tgz \
      --assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-debug.tar.gz \
      --assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-debug.tgz \
      -- prerelease \
      --target $ANCHOR_TAG "Master"
  fi

  if [[ $CONCURRENCY_SPEC == *"nightly" ]]; then
    # Publish to releases page, but do not push changes to the registry
    gh release create --assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname).tar.gz \
      --assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname).tgz \
      --assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname)-debug.tar.gz \
      --assets ./dist/dev-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-$(hostname)-debug.tgz \
      --assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S).tar.gz \
      --assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S).tgz \
      --assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-debug.tar.gz \
      --assets ./dist/$(hostname)-$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)-debug.tgz \
      -- prerelease \
      --target $ANCHOR_TAG "Nightly"
  fi
fi

```yaml name: Generate static files

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  static:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          token: ${{ secrets.GPR_AUTH_TOKEN_SHARED }}
      - uses: ruby/setup-ruby@v1
        with:
          ruby-version: '3.1'
          bundler-cache: true
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v3
        with:
          node-version: 16
          cache: 'npm'
      - name: Build
        run: npm ci
      - name: Generate static files
        run: |
          bundle exec rake utilities:build
          bundle exec rake docs:build
          bundle exec rake static:dump
      - uses: stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action@v4
        with:
          commit_message: Generating static files
          commit_user_name: GitHub Design Engineering Bot
          commit_user_email: primer-css@users.noreply.github.com
          commit_author: primer-css <primer-css@users.noreply.github.com>
          file_pattern: lib/primer/classify/utilities.yml static/*.json
